section.title: Future possibility
section.sectiontitle: Use will/won't + adverb to say how likely something is in the future. In positive sentences, willcomes before the adverb. In negative constructions, will comes after the adverb.
section.text1a: They will definitely come home. (you are certain)
section.text2a: I certainly won't be there. (you are certain)
section.sectiontitle2:
Use may/might/could when you are not certain. Do not use could in the negative. With modal verbs (will, may, might, could) use the infinitive
without to.
section.text3a:
Alice might meet us later for a drink.
(NOT: Alice might to meet us later for a drink.)
section.text4a: The shop may not be open.
